title: London, BL, Add. 17207
Digital Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Library
Hymns and discourses for various festivals and other occasions; but the present contents are as follow.
Hymns of Praise.
Prosphorici.
Stanzas to be chanted by the priests on breaking the consecrated bread.
Verses to be chanted in the church by the Psaltae, before the introduction of the holy Eucharist.
Prose homily of Jacob of Batnae on the Nativity of our Lord.
Hymns for Palm Sunday, some of which are by Severus.
Hymns for Good Friday, some of which are by Severus.
Short chants before the reading of the lessons from Scripture.
ܙܘܡܪ̈ܐ to be chanted at funeral services, before the reading of the Scriptures:
Order of the Funeral Service by Ephraim.
Discourse of Theophilus of Alexandria on the Separation of the Soul from the Body.
consolatory discourse for the Dead.
author: Jacob of Batnae
Ephraim
Theophilus of Alexandria

incipits: ܚܒܝ̈ܒܝ̣. ܡܦܣܝܢܢ ܕܩܫܝܐ ܗ̇ܝ ܟܪܝܘܬܐ ܕܚܒ̈ܝܒܝܗܘܢ ܕܒܢܝ̈ܢܫܐ ܥܠܝܗܘܢ. ܏ܘܫ.
otherLimit: ܆ܫܘܒܚܐ ܢܙܡܪ ܒܝܘܡܐ ܕܚܫܗ ܕܝܚܕܝܐ (sic)ܕܠܣܛܢܐ ܙܟܐ ܒܨܠܝܒܗ ܘܥܕܝ (sic)ܒܙܬܐ ܡܢ ܒܝܬ ܐܝܕܘܗܝ ܘܦܪܩܗ ܠܥܠܡܐ ܒܨܠܝܒܘܬܗ ܡܢ ܫܘܠܛܢܗ
